member.summary: Renders the content of the control.

member.name: M:UCommerce.Presentation.UI.DateTimePicker.GetDateTimeFormatForJquery
member.summary: JQuery UI component requires year format identifier in: 'yy'.
member.remarks: Returns the date time format in to lower to esnure the jquery plugin does not format the selected date with names instead of numbers.

member.name: M:UCommerce.Presentation.UI.DateTimePicker.GetTimeFormatForJQuery
member.summary: Time picker requires TT instead of tt to display AM and PM in uppercase.
member.returns: Returns the time pattern adjusted for date picker format.

member.name: M:UCommerce.Presentation.UI.DateTimePicker.EnsureOnlyTwoYearIdentifiers(System.String)
member.summary: Returns the correct identifier for a short time format according to standards in JQueryUI.s
member.remarks: Assumption: All cultures uses either 'yyyy' or 'yy' in their short date pattern. Unit test shows all default cultures in .NET does so.

member.name: M:UCommerce.Presentation.Web.IUrlResolver.ResolveUrl(System.String)
member.summary: Resolves the URL.
member.remarks: Assumes an URL local to the app, e.g. /catalog/somepage.aspx and resolves it to an URL matching the hosting environment of the app, i.e. app is hosted in /somedir. ~/catalog/somepage.aspx => /somedir/catalog/somepage.aspx.
